title: (x) "Sunoco" "Mike Cifelli's" Art Deco sans - Casablanca Cond {Mike F}
content:
I was told it was [this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carlos/) but wanted to be sure.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sunoco.jpg)

 [‹ Hebrew font--what is this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056/http:/typophile.com/node/19282 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Hudson's Bay flyer/Old Navy signage font - Chalet London 1960 {Miguel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056/http:/typophile.com/node/19284 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tateisgo

comments.content:
The light condensed is too light, I googled for a bold or medium condensed but couldn’t find one.  
Tim

It is mentioned that it is inspired from this, which has more weights:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/casablanca/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/casablanca/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/casablanca/")

Thanks for the help.

I also found [Decotura](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/decotura/), which is pretty similar.

I was able to get thousands of what appear to be quality URW fonts (both PS and.ttf) on a CD that came with a magazine called “Computer Arts” from the UK about two years ago at Barnes & Noble. A tremedous value. It was somewhere around $10. Those kinds of things don’t come by every day. That’s probably a good thing for the people who make fonts for a living?
Thanks, Yves. The RR website goes kerflooey now and then ... and now again.
